intro: Mattia lanata var. brachyantha, commonly known as the woolly mallow, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its soft, fuzzy, and hairy foliage. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is native to regions of southern Africa. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a velvety texture due to the dense covering of fine hairs. Mattia lanata var. brachyantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
